course.subject: MECH
course.name: Electrical Technology
course.description: Electromagnetic circuits, transformers, electromechanical energy conversion, DC machines, asynchronous and synchronous machines, special machines, transients and dynamics, three-phase circuits and power electronics, applications in electrical building services.

reviews.author: Jacky 01
reviews.title: Bad course arrangement
reviews.comment_content: It contain mainly four parts: AC circuits, Transformers, DC machines, Induction machines. The content is quite difficult as they are completely new for mech students.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecture material is messy. We have 3-5 lecture material for each section. And the professor keep switching between different materials. It is quite confusing. Also, they taught too fast for DC machine and Induction machine. The tutorial lecture notes doesn't contain answers for the question. TA also can't talk fluent during tutorial. But the worst part is the arrangements. For lab report they initially said we need to hand-in hand written group report. But just several hours before the deadline, they said we don't need to hand-write the report. But after the deadline, they said we need to use hand-write the report. Also, they gave instruction for lab after the deadline! But the worst part is the project, no one is sure how can we do the project. We need to do analysis for the motor, however some data need to made up by ourselves while others need to be calculated. But we are quite confused about that, which makes most of them don't know how to do the project.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due to the pandemic, we cancel the mid-term and final and replace them with one project.
20% Homework
20% Lab
60% Project
Final Grade: C+
The only grade they released is the homework, which I got 2 homework 9.5/10, other homework are all full marks. But the lab and project did not release any grade, and they count for 80% of the total grade. So I have no idea where we did bad for this course. Terrible grading transparency.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 7 homework need to be submitted. However, partial solution is provided. The partial solution is quite complete, it has every equation on it except the final answer. However, the project has the greatest workload as nobody is sure how to do it. There are only 2 labs. But they released it at the very end of the semester, which gave us huge workload from the project, lab report and other course's assignments. The project's workload is huge. There are quite a lot of things to do in the project. I and my 4 group-mates spend an entire night doing the project and so as other groups. You need to repeat to calculate data over and over. One part can easily cost 4-5 hours and there are several parts in the project. It can easily takes you 24 hours to finish one project. Also the project is due during exam, and it has way greater workload than exam.

reviews.author: Angry customer
reviews.title: NO IDEA WHAT I HAVE LEARNED! [ To those who will take this course in the coming semester, BEWARE! ]
reviews.comment_content: Mostly DC Machines, transformers, equivalent circuits that I believe most MECH students are quite familiar with. Also induction machine and motors ( one phase, three-phase...). There are also some calculations related to electric circuits.
reviews.comment_teaching:
TBH, I have only been to his lectures for the first month and he already mixed up some of the basic knowledge of electrical systems. For example, he mentioned that if the voltage was too large, it would pose danger to the user. BUT it is supposed to be CURRENT, NOT VOLTAGE! And he kept switching between different teaching materials. There were tons of appendices with his scribblings about induction machines and others contents. I got most of my learning done from reading the textbooks he suggested. In other words, I have learned nothing out of the lectures except the answers for that week's quizzes. What you will expect to get most of from his lectures will be the answers to the quizzes which make up 30% of the grades. From my experience, he only talked about conceptual knowledge about DC machines, induction machines, and motors, etc. while the tutorial done by TA focused more on calculation.

Also, he spent almost 10 mins in EACH lecture, YES, every lecture he had to mention about the grouping and wasted few mins, which I think can be done through Canvas and not waste everyone's time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment (15%)
Laboratory (15%)
Quiz (30%)
Project (40%)

10 assignments
25 quizzes and he would release two quizzes each week after each lesson
2 labs that were in video form
And a final project that took up most of the grades as the quizzes and assignments were both given model answers.

I have also been to some of the tutorials and the TA said the attendance would be counted into the final grade but I had not heard of any news about it ever again. SO I will stick to the official grading from the course outline.I guess the TAs weren't so sure about what they were doing as well.

My grade: C+ (◐‿◑)﻿
reviews.comment_workload: I think the course took a weird turn to decide to choose a project to fuck everyone up as we couldn't do a physical examination during the pandemic. Quoting from the lecturer, he said the reason to not have exams was that it would be unfair to have an online exam where someone might cheat. I completely understand the rationale behind it but I believe it is also unfair to those who were fucked by the poor arrangement of the project ( that is 40% of the grade!! ). As mentioned in a recent review of this course, the lab details were not released until the very end of the course. And the project was also a fucking mess that we had to find specs about an industrial-use induction motor with all info required to perform the calculations. So good luck to those who will take this course. Unless they change the course grading to not include such messed up project or they find other ways to torture our students.

reviews.author: hibadgrade
reviews.title: Good Grade Course even you did not attend lectures and tutorials
reviews.comment_content:
Before Midterm:
AC circuit
Single Phase/ Three Phase Transformer
After Midterm:
DC machines
AC machines

Course content covered some basic knowledge of omnipresent electricity machines.

Some said that the content is too difficult for a mechanical student with no in-depth electronic background. But i can tell you that they just did not pay effort in the course. I got C- in PHYS1114 which is about electronic, but A in MECH 3630.
Content is just elaborated based on basic laws, such as V=IR, N1V1 = N2V2, not as difficult as others said.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Almost useless. I did not study lecture notes provided by him at all. Just for viewing the course scope. The notes provided only contain very basic concept which is totally not enough for any assignment and exam. He did provided a handwritten exercise explanation which is the same as textbook but the words are difficult to understand.

Every sentence he said followed up with "HUH". I don't know what's wrong with his expression or maybe he is nervous at teaching. If you have played Minecraft, you will realize that he is VILLAGER that teaches electronic.

Therefore, with his annoying teaching style, I just take the first lesson and never attended again.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mean:
Assignment ~ 90%
Labs ~ not released
Midterm ~ 67.883%
Final ~ not released

Me score:
Assignment ~ 100%
Labs ~ guess 80%
Midterm ~ 81% (1.5SD)
Final ~ guess 50-60%( 2 out of 4 questions almost blanked XD, i guess there maybe errors in the question but it is still used by the TA)

Still get an A!(see attachment)
reviews.comment_workload:
What i did to get A without attending any lecture and tutorial is as followed.
1. Study the textbook on your own according to his teaching pace
His teaching is 80 mins for a lecture, but the textbook explanation just takes you 20 mins to fully understand.
2. Brush all the exercise after chapter before the exam
(Prof said the exam is very similar to the assignment, never trust him)

Assignment and lab just submit on time, that's all.

Studied few days for an A. Ez course!

reviews.author: Alex_3766
reviews.title: Infinite Looping
reviews.comment_content:
Taught about some basic electrical engineering content, which you do not have much experience in other MECH courses.
Magnetic circuit
Wiring
DC Motor
AC Motor
1 phase
3 phase
Y and Y connection
reviews.comment_teaching:
All I can say about his teaching is he has heart in teaching, but have a heart not necessarily will teach good.
If you attend his lessons, you will be like in infinite looping.
He keeps repeating the materials he taught last lessons.
And he explains some materials that would not be examined in great depth.
He would bring some toys to lectures and ask you not to destroy it. He will also play some youtube videos.
Some funny acsents, but you will get used to it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good indeed although I fxxked up my exams.
Good lucks as this is an inevitable course for MECH students.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not so heavy. There are ans provided to HW, Lab reports are jsut fill in the blanks. But you might have huge workload as you have to study yourself before the exams.
Study the books and the exercise behind if you have time.

reviews.author: Michelle(^=w=^)
reviews.comment_content: AC, 1 phase 3 phase transformer, DC motor, 1 phase 3 phase AC motor. Content are useful and quite interesting, the technology learnt can be found anywhere. Content are many and quite difficult
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor have provided example, drawing and hard written notes to help you understand, but still too theory. Tutorial section not very helpful.
TA just give you some time to work on the questions and then explain (read out) the answer. One of the TA(the only girl) teach very good although she speaks a little bit fast, she can develop and explain a very clear relation of the equation which really useful in calculating the questions. All the TA are very nice and help a lot on the lab.
reviews.comment_workload: 1 homework per weak, 2 labs, midterm and exam. Partial solution of the homework are given which help you finish the homework

reviews.author: bbmadevipalive
reviews.title: Academically hard but fair grade
reviews.comment_content:
magnetic circuits
transformers
DC machines
AC machines
The 4 main topics may seem easy coz they seem short enough? lol but its actually not the case
The contents may be difficult for mech students as we havnt studied any electrical course before and some contents are kind of abstract in my opinion.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Gao combined his ppt slides with some video clips and his lecture notes and also some hand-drawn figures to teach. However, his teaching was not easy to understand or did not simplify the taught contents much so very few students attended his lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got 0.5sd above mean for midterm
Not sure about homework scores as only scores of the first two homework were released
Final grade also not released
Got a B at the end
I guess I may have died in final
reviews.comment_workload:
10 homework but we were not asked to submits homework 8 to 10 due to the tight schedule
a midterm and a final exam
2 labs with reports to be submitted

reviews.author: hime
reviews.title: A so-so course
reviews.comment_content: basically electromagnetic theories, transformer, one phase three phase, dc machines, induction machines. Again, these knowledge will not be applied in work unless you want to continue your study in the future. Anyway, they are not hard to understand so just take these courses for the sake of learning new stuff.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tbh, I dont know what to say about his teaching. He may have the passion to teach, but his teaching skills are quite horrible. I recommend you not attending the lesson as it is a waste of time, you never understand his accent unless you are nds. Just go to search for some related youtube videos online and it is totally enough for this course.
The tutorial sessions are better than the lectures, yet they are not the greatest, so if you have spare time you can go, but it is still fine if you do not go
reviews.comment_grading: Typical grading for mech courses, you basically get a B (or B-?) if you reach the mean. The mean for the mid-term is around 70, and I believe if you understand the content well, you can easily get above 90 as the questions in both mid-term and final is not hard. Also remember to print the solution manual provided in Canvas if you want to score a high mark.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much, basically weekly assignment with solution provided, so you can just directly copy it. Two labs with easy lab report to hand in. The rest are mid-term and final. Probably the heaviest workload for this course is to study all the contents by yourself, as you cannot rely on the professor, as always.

reviews.author: ceo
reviews.title: Better have some electromagnetism background before studying this course!
reviews.comment_content: The course mainly focuses on electric machines such as transformers, DC motors and induction motors. Although this course has no pre-requisite, it requires a lot of background knowledge of electromagnetism as we will use equivalent circuit models in the analysis. It is better to include a chapter on reviewing the fundamentals before going into the real content. If you have studied PHYS1114, then it will be fine and you are likely to survive in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof always talked about his 'own' idea, but if you have a solid knowledge on electric circuits, you can also think about those on your own. He should speed up a little bit instead of too focusing on one aspect. But his english is fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
10 assignments, 2 lab reports, 1 midterm, 1 final

Typical grading for MECH course:
Assignments: ~13/15
Midterm: 90/100
Final: N/A
Grade: A+
As far as I know, the mean is around B or B+.

P.S. I have a very solid background on electromagnetism as I have studied PHYS1114 before, so I don't need to pay too much effort.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost weekly assignments with answers provided except the numbers, but I advise you to do it on your own before reading the solutions for clearing any misconceptions. Also, read the textbook on your own to get a clearer idea as the prof only speaks briefly on some concepts. The exams are open-book but be prepared to have a "chur" midterm as I don't have enough time finishing it. The final is reasonable.

The 2 lab reports are just fill in the blanks and easy calculations.

reviews.author: MS01
reviews.title: Good Grade Course but you learn nothing
reviews.comment_content:
Part 1:
- Magnetic circuit
- Transformer
--------Mid Term Exam-----------
Part 2:
- DC Machines (Motor and Generator)
- Induction Machines
--------Final Exam---------------

- Final Exam only covers chapters after the midterm exam.

- Textbook: P. C. Sen, Principles of Electric Machines and Power Electronics, 3rd Edition
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor GAO actually has passion in his subject, he prepares a lot of videos in order to visualize the phenomenon in electrical technologies. However, his teaching skill is not that good.

I skipped his lessons after week 2 and decided to self-learning the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment x10 (15%)
Laboratory x2    (15%)
Midterm Exam   (30%)
Final Exam         (40%)
----------------------------------------
My score:

Assignment 100% (as always)
Lab report: unknown result
Midterm Exam (95/100)
Final: unknown result, but I knew I was fucked up in it.

Final Grade: A

I think the grade is good, my friend gets below mean a lot in the midterm exam but manages to get into B range at the end of the course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment:
Total 10 of them, which provided with the solution. You could simply copy them and submit to TAs.

Lab:
5 - 6 people a group. Experiments are simple and straightforward.

Mid Term and Final Exam:
Open book styles and you could bring unlimited amounts of hard copies to both exams. Remember to bring solution manuals and homework answers along with you!

reviews.author: Adrianop
reviews.title: Literally meme prof
reviews.comment_content: Transformer, DC machines (motor& generator), synchronous motor.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, I skipped all his lessons and decided to self study as I really don't like his teaching style. If he can make the slides better it will be ok.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% HW
15% lab
30% midterm (got 90/100)
40% final exam (don't know the marks, as always)

Got an A, guess either I fucked up final or lab

Midterm and final are really hard (qs. taken out usually out of lecture, so do study yourself, also try to print the book since it is an open book exam)
(and I still don't know why I need Newton's method to numerically solve x^(1.125)+x=c etc..... in final)
reviews.comment_workload: Actually not much. HW are given WITH answers (so It is really easy marks for everyone), two labs are straightforward and lab reports are pretty simple.

reviews.author: cfszeto
reviews.comment_content: Electromagnetic circuits, transformers, electromechanical energy conversion, DC machines, asynchronous and synchronous machines, special machines, transients and dynamics, three-phase circuits and power electronics, applications in electrical building services.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Funny professor

Teaching skills is ok.  But don't only rely on his notes (or deadly grade you will get), as they are very brief.

Reading textbook is a must, so you must get a book along with you by any means.

Do questions provided by textbook is good, but there are a few only.  Finding other questions related to this course from the internet is a must if you want to master it
reviews.comment_workload:
Two lab reports are easy.
Ten homework sets but they are extracted from textbook with changing figures.

Exams are open book.  Bring a textbook can help a lot, though the question is a bit tricky

reviews.author: 浪子
reviews.comment_content:
magnetic circuit
transformer
DC machines
synchronous machines
Induction machines
single phase, three phase
Content : mid term exam , final exam , 9 assignment
open book exam , remember to bring solution manual

聽完都唔明, d 人話要上足堂woo ,u may try
